chart_metadata.name: pgadmin
chart_metadata.description: pgAdmin is the most popular and feature rich Open Source administration and development platform for PostgreSQL

runAsContext.description: pgAdmin runs as a non-root user.

capabilities.name: NET_BIND_SERVICE
capabilities.description: pgAdmin requires this ability to bind to privileged ports.

attrs.description: The certificate to use for pgAdmin

attrs.description: The path to store pgAdmin Configuration.

ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to a persistent volume claim.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: Size (in Gi)

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: CPU limit for pgAdmin.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid CPU limit formats are</br>
- Plain Integer - eg. 1</br>
- Float - eg. 0.5</br>
- Milicpu - eg. 500m

attrs.label: Memory
attrs.description: Memory limit for pgAdmin.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid Memory limit formats are</br>
- Suffixed with E/P/T/G/M/K - eg. 1G</br>
- Suffixed with Ei/Pi/Ti/Gi/Mi/Ki - eg. 1Gi</br>
- Plain Integer in bytes - eg. 1024</br>
- Exponent - eg. 134e6

1.2.8.app_readme:
pgAdmin

pgAdmin is the most popular and feature rich Open Source administration and development platform for PostgreSQL

When application is installed, a container will be launched with root privileges. This is required in order to apply the correct permissions to the pgAdmin directories. Afterward, the pgAdmin container will run as a non-root user (5050). All mounted storage(s) will be chowned only if the parent directory does not match the configured user.
1.2.8.detailed_readme:
pgAdmin

pgAdmin is the most popular and feature rich Open Source administration and development platform for PostgreSQL

When application is installed, a container will be launched with root privileges. This is required in order to apply the correct permissions to the pgAdmin directories. Afterward, the pgAdmin container will run as a non-root user (5050). All mounted storage(s) will be chowned only if the parent directory does not match the configured user.
